cols.StartTimestamp:
Start Timestamp
Tap the Record Start Timestamp button to make the date and time to appear.

Planet_Nickname.desc: Surveyor-assigned name for record-keeping purposes in the format of Surame-PlanetNumber.

Geotag.desc: Alphanumeric, recording the precise location of the planet being surveyed. This will be updated as we figure out how NMS uses co-ordinates, location, etc. Stay tuned!

Number_Of_Orbits.desc: Records how many orbits were completed of this planet by the surveyor.

Number_of_Features.desc: Enter the number of archaeological points of interest observed during planetary orbits.

Location_and_description.desc: Free-text to describe generally the planet being surveyed. This could include access, relation to other planets/transects/systems, land use etc.

Survey_Procedure.Area_Surveyed:
Area Surveyed (sq. km.)
Numeric size of area surveyed, in square kilometers. Can be approximate.
Survey_Procedure.Bearing:
Bearing (degrees)
Compass heading in the direction of travel for the transect.

Comment_on_transect.desc: Free-text description about the nature and reason for conducting the transect. This could include identifying "other" macro-artefacts, built environments, glitches, explanation of field procedures, etc.

Video_Capture_URL.desc: Record the link to video captured by the surveyor on Twitch, YouTube, etc.

Screengrab_Filename.desc: Name of the file of a screenshot taken while completing the transect for future reference. Format for filenames: Surname-PlanetNumber-IncrementalNumber.filetype.

Attach_a_Screengrab.desc: Tap the “Attach File” button to upload the screenshot to the FAIMS NMSAS server. Works only on Android devices. If you are using an emulator, please follow instructions for uploading screenshots using the FAIMS web server.

Dominant_Planet_Coverage.desc: Check as many as apply. Use annotation on "other" to identify any other planet coverage.

Percentage_of_Visable_Surface.desc: Percentage of surface visiable from orbiting altitude. If you can see the planet’s surface without any obstruction from atmosphere or cloud, enter 100.

Comment_on_planetary_coverage.desc: Any general comments on planetary coverage that do not meaningfully 'fit' as simple annotations of the checkbox options.

Comment_on_surface_conditions.desc: Comments on surface conditions, glitches or unintended game behaviour, etc. For future visitors, note the difficulty of surface travel for walking or for vehicles.

Features.desc: Note any outstanding features on the planet (e.g., Jupiter’s Great Red Spot).

Revisit.Revisit:
Revisit?
Indicate if the planet merits a return visit by archaeologists and if so, why.
Yes No

Orbit_Number.desc: Enter the cardinal number for your orbit of the planet (e.g., 1, 2, 3, etc.).

Agriculture.desc: Count any agricultural areas spotted on the flyover (e.g., fields). Annotate as needed.

Architecture.desc: Count any architectural features spotted on the flyover (e.g., houses, temples). Annotate as needed.

Communications.desc: Count any communications features spotted on the flyover (e.g., antennae). Annotate as needed.

Cultural.desc: Count any cultural features spotted on the flyover (e.g., art, statues). Annotate as needed.

Industry.desc: Count any industrial features spotted on the flyover (e.g., factories). Annotate as needed.

Military.desc: Count any military features spotted on the flyover (e.g., barracks). Annotate as needed.

Mining.desc: Count any mining features spotted on the flyover (e.g., shafts). Annotate as needed.

Transport.desc: Count any transportation features spotted on the flyover (e.g., launchpads). Annotate as needed.

Settlement.desc: Count any settlements spotted on the flyover (e.g., villages). Annotate as needed.

Other.desc: Count any other features spotted on the flyover. Annotate.

Unit_ID.desc: Auto-incremental and tied to the current transect.

Row_Number.desc: Enter the cardinal number of the row (e.g., 1, 2, 3, etc.).

Metal.desc: Count any metal items encountered on the walk through. Annotate as needed.

Sherd.desc: Count any sherds encountered on the walk through. Annotate as needed.

Lithic.desc: Count any lithics encountered on the walk through. Annotate as needed.

Technology.desc: Count any technology encountered on the walk through. Annotate as needed.

Structure.desc: Count any structures encountered on the walk through (e.g., buildings). Annotate as needed.

Wreck.desc: Count any wrecks encountered on the walk through (e.g., ships, etc.). Annotate as needed.

Monolith.desc: Count any monoliths encountered on the walk through. Annotate as needed.

Settlement.desc: Count any settlements encountered on the walk through. Annotate as needed.
